Hi Ryan,

On 16 January 2014 14:31, Ryan Hall <ryanhallcs@...> wrote:
> In the latest version of SharpNeat (2.2) ... subtle but high impact bug in
> using FastAcyclicNetworkFactory.c

Thanks for the find and fix. I'll aim to review your fix and publish
the fixed version soon.


> The impact is incorrect networks using the FastAcyclicNetworkFactory only
> if the genome's nodes depend on different activation functions.

So this mostly affects HyperNEAT experiments in 2.2. I think the fast
acyclic code is also used for a number of NEAT experiments in 2.2, but
they are using a single activation fn, so based on Ryan's comments
shouldn't be affected.


> (a shame this library isn't on GitHub...)

What are people's favourite code repositories currently? I think
sourceforge supports git now, so maybe I should just switch to that?

Regards,

Colin
